original: Holst, Walfrid, lektor, Skövde, f. 12/ 6/97 i Kristianstad av Nils H. o. Elna Bengts-son. — Stud:ex. i Kristianstad 15, fil. mag.^i Lund 21, fil. lic. 29, fil. dr 31, provår 32-33. Vistades huv:-sakl. på resor inom o. utom Europa, syssels. m. hist., geogr. o. litt. stud., bl. a. v. Univ., högsk. o. arkiv i Sthlm, Upps., Köpenhamn, Berlin, Dresden, Marburg, Paris, Madrid o. Simancas 21-23 o. 25-30, efter lektorsutnämn. flera stud :res. i Europa, Nordafrika o. Främre Asien. E. lär. v. Mora komm. mellansk. 24-25, vik. lektor i Kalmar 31-32, lektor v. Eksjö h. a. 1. 33, lektor i hist. o. geogr. v. Skövde h. a. I. sed. 41. Skr.: Carl Gustaf Tessin under rese-, riksd:manna- o. de tid. be-skickn:åren (grad:avh. 31), Carl Gustaf Tessin, en grandseigneur fr. XVIII :de sekl. (36), kap. Statslivet i Frih :tidens tecken o. Svea Rikes lag i band VI av Sv. folket genom tiderna (38), art. rör. 1600- o. 1700-talens hist. i Sv. uppsl :bok, art. i tidn. o. tidskr., krön:spel f. radio, redig, serien Levande 1700-tal där 39-40, rec. av hist. litt. i Bibl:bladet sed. 41 m. m. von Hoist, Hans Vilhelm, prakt, läkare, Göteborg, f. 23/9/77 i Sthlm av majoren o. kammarh. Johan Gustaf v. H. o. Elisabeth Zethelius. G. 1. 07-20 m. Anna Maria Elisabeth Källström; 2. 29 m. Ester Carlson. Barn: Elisabeth f. 09, Johan Hübner 11, Hans Einar 13, Birgitta 15, Gunilla 17. — Mo!g:ex. i Sthlm 98, med. kand. i Upps. 06, med. lic. i Sthlm 11. E. o. aman. v. anat. inst. i Upps. 03-04 o. 05, und:läk. v. Seraf :lias. kir. khn. 09-10, dito v. Falu las. kir. avd. 11-13, andre läk. v. Sahlgr. sjukh. kir. avd. 13-17, prakt. läk. i Gbg sed. 17, div. vik. v. las. o. sjukh. 17-29, chefsläk. v. ambul. i Finl. 18. Fältläk :stip. i res. 0’7, div. mil:lak:förordn. 08-18, bat:-läk. v. Göta art :reg. 21-35, reg:läk. i Fik 27-35. FFrK2kl, FMM, SMsjv.
translated:
Holst, Walfrid, lecturer, Skövde, born on June 12, 1897 in Kristianstad to Nils H. and Elna Bengtsson. He passed the student exam in Kristianstad in 1915, received a Bachelor of Arts degree in Lund in 1921, a Master of Philosophy degree in 1929, a PhD in 1931, and completed a probationary year in 1932-33. He spent most of his time traveling within and outside of Europe, studying history, geography, and literature, including at universities, colleges, and archives in Stockholm, Uppsala, Copenhagen, Berlin, Dresden, Marburg, Paris, Madrid, and Simancas in 1921-23 and 1925-30. He went on several study trips in Europe, North Africa, and the Middle East after being appointed a lecturer. He was a teacher at Mora municipality intermediate school in 1924-25, a substitute lecturer in Kalmar in 1931-32, a lecturer at Eksjö higher secondary school in 1933, and a lecturer in history and geography at Skövde higher secondary school since 1941. His writings include Carl Gustaf Tessin during his traveling years, as a member of parliament, and during his official duties in the early days (thesis, 1931), Carl Gustaf Tessin, a grandseigneur from the 18th century (1936), a chapter on State governance during the age of liberty and Svea Rikes laws in volume VI of The Swedish People Throughout History (1938), articles on history in the Swedish reference book, articles in newspapers and magazines, historical dramas for radio, and editing the series Living in the 18th century in 1939-40. He also reviewed historical literature in the Library Journal since 1941, and more. 

von Hoist, Hans Vilhelm, a practical physician, Gothenburg, born on September 23, 1877 in Stockholm, to the major and chamberlain Johan Gustaf von Hoist and Elisabeth Zethelius. He married Anna Maria Elisabeth Källström in 1907 and they divorced in 1920. He married Ester Carlson in 1929. His children are Elisabeth, born in 1909, Johan Hübner in 1911, Hans Einar in 1913, Birgitta in 1915, and Gunilla in 1917. He passed the morgue exam in Stockholm in 1898, graduated from Uppsala University with a degree in medicine in 1906, obtained a medical license in Stockholm in 1911. He was employed as an assistant and researcher at the anatomy institute at Uppsala University in 1903-04 and 1905, an assistant doctor at Seraflias surgical hospital in 1909-10, at Falu hospital surgical department from 1911-1913, and a medical officer at Sahlgr hospital surgical department in 1913-1917. He has been a practicing physician in Gothenburg since 1917, a substitute physician at various hospitals and clinics in 1917-1929, and the chief physician at an ambulance in Finland from 1918. He received army medical scholarships in 1907, various military medical appointments from 1908-1918, served as a battalion doctor in Göta artillery regiment from 1921-1935 and as a regiment doctor in Fik from 1927-1935. He was awarded the Royal Order of the Sword, 2nd class, the Order of Vasa, and the Swedish Red Cross Medal.
